column2: This position demands a higher writing ability , so please say something about your writing ability .
column3: Of course . I've loved writing since I was a very little boy . I won the first prize in a national composition contest when I was in middle school . After attending Nanjing University , I never give up writing . My works , such as Father's Tobacco Pipe , Open Air Cinema , The old City were respectively published China Youth Daily , Yangzi Evening News , and New Beijing . During the period of studying for my degrees of master and doctor , I paid more attention to developing my research ability and published several papers . The Impact of Internet in Chinese Political Participation , The Discipline of Remold , The Historical Direction of Chinese Administration Reform , Bribery Cases of Self governance in Chinese Villages are respectively published in Chinese Publish Administration , Beijing Due Xuebao , Theory and Society and Chinese Reform . I joined in Yangzi Evening News to work as a part-time journalist in 2006 . During this period , I've written a lot of comments , which improved my writing ability to a new level , I have full confidence in my writing ability , and I believe I can do the job well .

Finally , she can make notes in shorthand and types and has the skills in report writing , summary writing , keep minutes at meetings , and so on . Most important of all is that she seems to have a better memory than average .

I suspect that there ' s some sort of foreign object in the pipes that ' s causing a blockage . That ' s what ' s making your toilet overflow .

Thatcould be causing water to not drain completely , that might lead to more problems in the future . I would also suggest fixing this faucet that isn ' t shutting off properly . I could have it all finished by today if it ' s urgent .

column13: I know who we can ask . There is a girl I know , Sara Ralston . She is 17 , and she will usually take this kind of job . I know her from my church , and I trust her completely .
column14: I'd like to talk with her . This is short notice , I know . But Hank and I are leaving tonight .

column2: Hi , George . I'm going to have a job interview next week . Could you give me some advice ?
column3: Sure . First of all , it ' s very important for you not to be late . Job interviewers usually don ' t think very highly of a candidate who arrives ten minutes after the appointed time , only to explain that he could not find the place or that there was heavy traffic .
column4: Yeah , that's very important .
column5: So you ' d better explore the place the day before and at the same time , look around to see what the employees are wearing . So the next day you will arrive early for the appointment .
column6: I ' ll try my best to make a good impression on the interviewer .
column7: That ' s right . You need to create a good image in a limited time , usually about 30 to 45 minutes .
column8: It ' s always easier to say something than to do it .
column9: It ' s not too difficult to make a good impression . For example , you should take care to appear well-groomed and modestly dressed . Avoid the extremes of a too elaborate or too casual style . This will put you on the same level as other applicants and make the interviewer consider more important qualifications .
column10: But I love wearing T-shirts and jeans .
column11: I advise you not to wear a too casual style when going to an interview . Informal clothes as well as torn jeans and dirty shoes convey the impression that you are not serious about the job , or that you may be casual about your work as you are about your clothes .
column12: It ' s a pity that I cannot afford more expensive clothes .
column13: You misunderstood me . Clothes which are too colorful or too expensive suggest that you do not understand what behavior is appropriate for the job , or that you are snobbish or frivolous .
column14: I know what you mean . I ought to wear right clothes at the right time .
column15: You got it . Only in this way can you gain the respect of the interviewer and his confidence in your judgement .
column16: It seems that ' clothes make the man ' .
column17: It may not be true , but the first and lasting impression of you is determined by your clothes and behavior .

column2: Can I help you ?

column7: Kreng ? I've never heard of that company .
column8: It's a German company . This unit has auto-reverse , recording capability , and an AM / FM radio band . It also has a built-in microphone .
column9: I suppose I don't want that one then . I don't like auto-reverse . It breaks too easily .

column11: Yes , twice now . I think it's too high-tech , and so it's the first part that breaks .
column12: Hmm . You know , the problem might be dust . Did you clean the unit often ?
column13: Well . No , I didn't clean it . But still , I only had the last one two months , and it broke . I don't trust auto-reverse .
column14: Alright . Well . We have many units without auto-reverse . Here is a good unit . Very reliable . It has an AM / FM band , built-in microphone , recording capability , and no auto-reverse .
column15: How much is it ?
column16: This one sells for $ 39 . 99 .
column17: Can I test it out ?
column18: Of course .
column19: It sounds great . I'll take it .
column20: Fine . I think you'll be happy with it . It's a very good unit . Very reliable . I'll go get you a new one in a box . I will be back in just a moment .

column2: Tell me about yourself .
column3: I was born and raised in Beijing . I attended Peking University and received my bachelor's degree in Economics . I have worked for 2 years as a financial consultant in Beijing for China Pacific Insurance Co . Ltd .
column4: What type of position are you looking for ?
column5: I'm looking for a position in which I can utilize my experience .
column6: Are you interested in a full-time or part-time position ?
column7: I am more interested in a full-time position . However , I would also consider a part-time position .
column8: Can you tell me about your responsibilities at your last job ?
column9: I advised customers on financial matters . After I consulted the customer , I completed a customer inquiry form and catalogued the information in our database . I then collaborated with colleagues to prepare the best possible package for the client . The clients were then presented with a summarized report on their financial activities that I formulated on a quarterly basis .
column10: What is your greatest strength ?
column11: I am an excellent communicator . People trust me and come to me for advice . One afternoon , my colleague was involved with a troublesome customer who felt he was not being served well . I made the customer a cup of coffee and invited both my colleague and the client to my desk where we solved the problem together .
column12: What is your greatest weakness ?
column13: I tend to spend too much time making sure the customer is satisfied . However , I began setting time-limits for myself .
column14: Why do you want to work for our company ?
column15: After following your firm's progress for the last 3 years , I am convinced that your company is becoming one of the market leaders and I would like to be a part of that team .
column16: When can you begin ?
column17: Immediately .

column2: Please tell me how to file things according to the concerned rules .

column4: What are they ?
column5: They are keep the documents in chronological order , remove all the chips and pins , punch the documents evenly and place them in the folder .
column6: And what is the most important point ?
column7: You should always remember that one customer one file is the rule .

column3: How do you do , Jack . Nice to meet you .

column6: I should not be surprised , many customers have the same opinion . Do you have any suggestion in mind ? Our salesman told your secretary that the price could be negotiable .
column7: That's why I came to your office today . We think for your model WE - 506 $ 590 would be reasonable , because air conditioners of the same kind sold by other companies are usually about 579-649 .
column8: That's true . But if you understand that quality is the most important aspect of a product , you'll agree that 679 is not high , especially when we allow you a 10 % discount .
column9: I see your point . That's to say s 611 each set . Still it's much higher than the market price . Could you see your way to reduce the price , Jack ?
column10: Well , considering the quantity of your order we could further reduce the price to 600 . That's the best we can do . What do you think of that ?
column11: All right . We accept it . So $ 600 for each set .
column12: Very well . Thank you .

column5: I'm quite outgoing i think . I enjoy mixing and doing things with others .

column7: I maintain that the most important thing is having good friends . A person can't live all by himself I think . A friend in need is a friend in deed . The more really close friends I have , the better .

column9: People who are honest , dedicated to their work and having integrity .

column2: I would like to take this opportunity to welcome Monica to our company and introduce her to her department and colleagues . For all of you , we hired Monica because she is a very professional accountant and we are very happy to have her in the finance department . She has lots of working experiences as an accountant and I am sure everybody in the department can benefit from this .

I am very happy to meet everyone and I am looking forward to working well with all of you . I am very happy to be one of the team and I will do my best to get into the working situation as soon as possible . By the way , call me Monica . Everybody calls me so .

column2: Margaret , I'd like to follow up with the arrangements for our company retreat , to take place next month . We need to book the venue , make arrangements for speakers and door prizes , and set up all the activities and accommodations . Also , very important , we need to determine which of our staff will be eligible and will be available to go . We've got to get a head count in order to make reservations .
column3: What's the criteria for staff to attend ? Are we only including our management team in this affair ? Or will we be extending invitations to lower level employees to attend ?
column4: Lower level employees need not attend . The purpose of this retreat is for training , especially for our management team . We want to develop a well-oiled machine on our executive level . In order to get everyone to jell together , we've got to include some fun . That's the reason for the retreat .

column7: You should try swimming then . It helps you to keep fit .

column4: How are your typing and shorthand skills ?
column5: I can type 80 words a minute , basically no mistake , and can take dictation in English at 120 words per minute .

column2: What's the matter with me , Doctor ? I feel so tired these days .
column3: Is your blood pressure , I'm afraid . It's far too high .
column4: And what's the cause of that ?
column5: Overwork-amongst other things . You can't work 24 hours a day . You ' Ve got to slow down .
column6: But I can't just slow down .
column7: You've got to , I'm afraid . And look at this . You weigh 200 stones . That's too much for a man of your size .
column8: You mean I've got to lose weight ?
column9: Yes . You've got to cut down on bread and potatoes and take more exercise .

column2: You are an early bird , Tom . What do you do in the morning then ?
column3: Exercise . The morning hours are the most precious period within a single day . We should not pass them up easily . Seize the time and do something useful .
column4: So , you choose to spend it on bodybuilding . Where do you exercise ?
column5: Usually , I run to the Black Bamboo Park as a warm-up . Admission is free . Then I start my activities .
column6: Do you do the same exercises every day ?
column7: No , I've deliberately kept a balance between various exercises ; parallel bars , push-ups , sit-ups , bunny-hops , five-kilometer run , and so on . I alternate them over the weekdays . Sometimes , when I find myself in a bad state , I will simply idle about in the park .
column8: Why don't you just stay in bed when you are feeling unfit for exercising ?
column9: It's not easy to keep a good habit , you know . I fear that if I fail to get up early one day , I may find it still more difficult to rise early the next . Besides , a mere walk in the early morning is much fun , too . Here and there in the park , you meet whole gangs of senior citizens who might be singing operas or old songs , playing er'hu , chess , or just chatting and gossiping . It's interesting to join them .
column10: Oh , yes . Singing is also a good way of keeping fit , at least mentally .

column3: I think Pond's is the best .
column4: And they're very dear , too .
column5: They're on special offer today .
column6: Oh , that's ideal .

column2: What ' s the problem ? Things are getting out of hand . You keep sticking your nose where it doesn ' t belong .

column4: Well , as you know , I have recently become the sole distributor for Grangers Gourmet Bon-bons here in the United States . They ' re a new manufacturer and are looking to break into the luxury market . Naturally , your restaurant sprang into my mind immediately . I think your brand exemplifies many of the same traits as Grangers and serving these chocolates would really add to your reputation for providing elegant , luxurious , first class dining .

column8: That ' s what makes this such a fantastic opportunity ! The government is one hundred percent supportive of creating new export markets and has guaranteed a low tariff for all wholesale orders of over one thousand units . They ' Ve also reduced the red tape involved at customs as well . Here , I brought these especially for you , try one !

column10: Unique , aren ' t they ? I bet you ' Ve never tasted anything like it ! Quality is assured as I personally visit the factory to make sure no one ' s cutting corners with the ingredients . Only the creme make it through inspection .

column2: So tell me , what's the difference between the Board of Directors , the CEO , and the stockholders ? They all seems ot be the same group of people to me ...
column3: No , there's a definite difference . You know , the stockholders are the people who own the company ... they're the financial control system . Then there's the CEO -- the chief executive officer . He's the hot shot , the main guy who is the boss . If there is only one person with absolute power in the organization , everyone knows that the power will go to their head . It's too dangerous . That's the reason for a Board of Directors . The board is made up of people who are experts in the industry . They could be related to the organization , but more commonly , they are independent and non-biased .
column4: How many people are on the board of directors ?
column5: Usually not more than 15 , not less than 10 . They meet monthly , quarterly , or biannually to oversee an organization or company . They provide long term planing and vision , and also act as moral watchdogs rto keep the company in line .

column9: Whatever you say !

column2: Have you declared your income and are you prepared to pay tax ?
column3: Not yet . I don't know how to fill out the form . What is the tax-free allowance for supporting a dependent ?
column4: I don't really know . Why not ask the accountant or the lawyer of the law firm ? They will tell you which is subject or not subject to taxation . He can even help you avoid paying tax legally .
column5: If I don't pay my taxes , would the tax officials discover it ?
column6: Certainly . No one who evades tax can escape from their detection . They ' ll check your income through computers . You'd better make a declaration to the tax authorities as soon as possible . If you fail to meet the deadline , you will be fined .

column2: What's up ? You sound a little down in dumps .
column3: I quarreled with my roommate last night . He is really stubborn .
column4: Calm down ! Shouting won ' t help ?
column5: He is really outrageous .
column6: What happened ?
column7: I went back home last night . You know tired as a dog , so I took a quick shower and went to bed . I couldn't fall asleep , because Brian was there in the living room , playing his stupid stereo so loud . I kindly told him to turn that down a little bit . He shouted at me .
column8: What ? He can't do this to you .
column9: Well , he did it anyway . Then he came into my room and shot all his shit blah blah blah ... you know .
column10: What did you do ?
column11: I shouted it back of course .
column12: Hold it , Mike . You won't accomplish anything by hollering at him , right ? You worked it all up till now . Why not wait until you cool down a bit ?
column13: What would you do if you were in my shoes ?
column14: Just stay cool . You know . When you get back home tonight , tell him that you didn't mean to quarrel with him .
column15: No way , Kate . I mean it's just not my fault .
column16: I know . It wouldn't hurt much to say sorry first . And after that , you can casually mention the problem . I am sure he will cooperate .
column17: I am too angry to do that .

column7: I ' m terrible at cards and so I never play games which involve gambling , like poker . If I did , I ' d lose all my money .

column9: Yes , I do . It ' s hard to find four players though , so I don ' t play very often . Do you know anyone who plays ? If so , we could set up a game .
column10: I can play quite well . I have a friend who likes playing , but she ' s not very good at it . Shall I invite her to play ?
column11: Sure , I have a friend who play fairly well . We should find out when our friends are free and arrange a game .
column12: I ' ll call my friend now . you call yours .

column7: The second day you take a four-hour city tour . In the afternoon you go on the famous boat cruise under the falls .

column2: Tell me about yourself and your past experience .
column3: I have worked as an executive secretary for 5 years , first for trading companies , and now I am working for a trust company . I interact well with peers , clients , administrators and bosses . I thrive on challenge and work well in high-stress environments .
column4: How are your typing and shorthand skills ?
column5: I can type 100 Chinese words a minute and take dictation in English at 150 words a minute .
column6: Can you operate computers skillfully ?
column7: Yes , I can . I have received some special training in computers . Besides I am good at operating common office machines , such as fax machines and duplicating machines .
column8: Sometimes we are very busy and need to work overtime . How do you feel about that ?
column9: That's all right . But could you tell me how often and how many hours I should work overtime ?
column10: It just depends . If we have important visiting delegations , you have to stay with us . It's not unusual .
column11: Mr . Smith , I's like to ask you a question .
column12: OK , please .
column13: What specific duties would I perform if I am hired ?
column14: Nothing different from a secretary's common responsibilities . However , you know , our company is an international trade-oriented company , can you handle English papers and write English correspondence ?
column15: Yes . I specialized in English secretary studies at college and that's one of the main parts of my present job .
column16: What are your salary expectations ?
column17: I really need more information about the job before we start to discuss salary . Maybe you could tell me what is budgeted for the position .
column18: The starting monthly salary would be  2,000 , with rises after the half year according to your competence .
column19: I think it's acceptable and I really like the job . And when can I know the decision ?
column20: We'll inform you of our final decision by early July . Do you have any other questions ?
column21: No . Thank you for the time .

column2: What do you think about the equipment in our company ?
column3: We have to equip our company with a network of work stations at every office and show room as soon as possible .
column4: I also realized this issue . And office automation is essential .
column5: Besides , Internet tends to be more essential now in the information age .
column6: Good idea . A network of work stations is helpful for our management .
column7: And , to be frank , our copying machines are too slow ; our telephone system is limited in function .
column8: You are right . The current equipment of our offices really falls behind . Next week , you can provide me a catalogue of new equipment .

The exhibition has successfully displayed to me what your corporation handles . I ' Ve gone over the catalogue and the pamphlets enclosed in your last letter . I ' Ve got some idea of your exports . I ' m interested in your silk blouses .
column7: Our silk is known for its good quality . It is one of our trade - trional exports . Silk blouses are brightly colored and beau - fully designed . They ' Ve met with great favor overseas and are always in great demand .

column10: I think we should hire a live band .

column6: I need job security .

column10: I need at least 75,000 per year .

column2: I find that you spend little on handset charge every month . Have you any trick ?

column2: Yes , madam ? Can I help you ?

column19: There it is . That is the pattern ! The set behind you . Thank goodness , they haven't been sold . And thank you so much for being so patient with me . Yes , those are the ones .

column9: Actually , you cannot mail it in early , as it needs to reflect all of the information up to the due date .

column11: Your check will arrive a little late .

column2: So , Monica , how do you like your new office ?
column3: Well , I love it . The room is spacious and clean with big windows and a lot of sunshine . There are plants along the corridor . Especially , I got my own desk with computer and telephone . Such a great place !
column4: That ' s very good . I once turn down a job offer just because the office is awful .
column5: What was so bad about it ?
column6: Small rooms , small window , a small desk shared by three people . I would have been interrupted all the time and for sure not be able to deliver good work .
column7: Sounds bad ! Lucky you ! You didn ' t take that job . I think a good office environment is also important to work efficiently .
column8: Totally agree . By the way , the number of the telephone on your desk is extension 506 . You can pick up your office supplies from the supply room at the end of the corridor .

column2: Now , if I look here I see that you completed a BA in English ?

column4: Yes , I ' m pleased to see that you also got a distinction .
column5: Yes that ' s right . I ' Ve always enjoyed studying . My friends say I ' m a bit of a bookworm , but my father always pushed us to succeed academically .
column6: Well , it looks like his encouragement paid off Rebecca . So how about extracurricular activities at University ?
column7: Well I ' Ve always been keen on writing , so I became the editor for the University student magazine , which I really loved . Also I volunteered for a group called Shelter , to help the homeless in York .
column8: What did that involve ?
column9: Providing warm meals and shelter , especially in the winter months . I found it really fulfilling to be part of that group .
column10: I ' m sure . Okay , now let ' s move on to your work experience , shall we ?
column11: Yes , okay .

column5: Yes , I never seem to have any energy .
column6: I'll give you a blood test . Would you roll up your sleeve ? Just as I thought . You're anemic . You'd better pay more attention to your diet . Eat plenty of fresh fruit and vegetables and food high in protein . And don't stay up late working . Try to get more rest .
column7: Thank you .

column2: What type of people do you work with most effectively ?
column3: I tend to work well with people who are confident and straightforward . It ' s more difficult for me to be around timid people , because I move quickly and I am decisive .
column4: What things impress you in your colleagues ?
column5: I admire and work best with people who are of good character and integrity . I also think confidence and enthusiasm is positive in any business environment .
column6: What are some of the things your supervisor did that you disliked ?
column7: The only thing I really don't like is to get feedback in front of others . I want to hear good and bad feedback in private , so that I have time to think and react to the issue without other distractions . I believe that's the fair way to improve learning or to change future behavior .
column8: How do you organize and plan for major projects ?
column9: I love to brainstorm a best , worst , and most likely scenario . Then , I set a timetable that's realistic . What I usually find is that some combination of my schedule easily as these things unfold because I've already visualized what could happen and how I'd react .
column10: Describe an experience when you had to work under great pressure .
column11: I had to complete an end of quarter report once while I was on the road for two consecutive weeks . The amount of telephoning back and forth was incredible , because I could't bring my office files with me . Luckily I had a great secretary and a logical filling system , so we located everything we needed .
column12: How do you manage your time in a typical day ?
column13: I've always given priority to work with established clients , because they offer a better risk / return value . The last thing I do is general correspondence , especially internal correspondence , which I take care of at the end of the day or week .
column14: Describe a time when you acted on someone's suggestion .
column15: I changed my open office hours because several of my employees found it difficult to visit me except in the early mornings .

column2: Did you get Bean's ten different good luck forwards , like that one from the Dalai Lama ?

column4: I figured I might as well send one or two of them out . Maybe my luck will get better .
column5: Do you really think the Dalai Lama sent that ? I'm tired of all these forwards .
column6: It's worth a shot . Maybe we'll get some luck in thinking up something for this case .

column5: He said there was a traffic jam , but he is coming .

column4: Some Chinese food . I'm hungry , and there's a take-out restaurant near here . We can have them deliver and then watch the news on TV while we eat .
column5: No , I'd rather go out . The Chinese food here is rather different from what I had at home . Maybe we can try some other food today ... What about that all-you-can-eat place we passed the other day , the one over in the shopping center ?
column6: Okay . I could go for that . It's called Al's Steakhouse . They also have great fried fish , and I love their salad bar . You can go back to refill your plate as often as you like .
column7: Is that the place that serves such large portions of meat ?
column8: Yes , their steaks are enormous . Sometimes I can't finish what I've ordered .
column9: What if that happens to me ? I hate to let food go to waste .
column10: Don't worry . We'll just get a doggie bag .

column5: Is that true ?
column6: Definitely !

column8: Mmm , well this is our I ' m sorry I cheated on you package . Two dozen red roses lined with tulips , carnations and lilies . The fragrance and beauty of this flower arrangement is sure to make her forgive you .
column9: I don ' t think that ' s gonna cut it . I need something bigger and better !

column9: Right now I show that there are 176 people on the list . And you are number 176 .

column2: How do you think they could be ended ?
column3: I don't think that there is any easy way . The United Nations could send peacekeepers into the country . At least then the warring parties could be forced to negotiate .

column2: The last thing to be ignored at a Chinese dinner table is to keep modest .
column3: Does that suggest diners avoid speaking much ? The same is true in the West .
column4: No , absolutely not ! On the contrary , you'll be considered a well-connected , sociable man , if you keep involved in the conversation all the time . But always pay attention to what you say . If the table has a senior guest , say something as upbeat and cheerful as possible . Or maybe , you may give the floor to him and keep listening as if very interested .
column5: You mean , keeping a low profile in the presence of the old ? That goes in like with Confucius ' preachings , right ?
column6: Correct . Show respect for the older people . Conventionally , before the meal starts , the younger members are supposed to address each one of the elderly members of the table one by one . Others are kept in waiting until the most venerable guest proclaim the beginning of the meal and takes the first bite . Toasts also go to these men first before people can toast to each other .
column7: Any other rules to observe in order to keep modest ?
column8: Yes , plenty of them . Don't eat fast ! People usually keep their dining pace accorded with others . And all the dishes should not be eaten up completely .
column9: Is it because that would give the host the impression that the food was insufficient ?
column10: Haha , I'm afraid it's simply because no one wishes to be too noticeable by finishing off the plate .

column2: Our toner cartridges are already out of ink ... Could you make an order for a new set ?

column4: You can double check with the housekeeping department , but I am pretty sure all of the machines will need new cartridges . Last time when we made our order to the supplier , the quantity was also especially high . They are used to receiving such bulk orders from us . As long as we give them a heads up a couple days in advance , they can usually fill the order .
column5: OK , I will make a few calls and run our order by housekeeping first to make sure . Is there anything else we need to order while I am at it ?
column6: I think the only thing is toner . Try to see if they can deliver it before the end of business day tomorrow . We should really try to do better about waiting until the last minute to fill orders that are usually made on a monthly basis . Anyhow , see what you can do to expedite the order this time .

column2: Hello . Nice to see you again . I heard you went into hospital for a few days to undergo surgery . I hope everything ' s OK .

column6: It must have really hurt afterwards .
column7: Well , the nurse game me plenty of painkillers , but it did feel uncomfortable . I wasn ' t permitted to eat anything for 48 hours . That was the worse thing .
column8: I bet you were ready for a thick juicy steak when you got out of hospital .

column10: Is there any pain now ?
column11: No , not at all . I stopped taking painkillers after a couple of days .
column12: Did they take good care of you in the hospital ?
column13: Oh , yes . The nurse were very kind , though they were strict about what I could drink . In the end , I just drank water and nothing else . Everyone was very professional and I actually enjoyed some aspects of my stay .

column2: Did you set your clock forward for daylight savings time ?
column3: What ? Why do we have to do that ?
column4: Well , at the start of the spring we usually have more daylight in the mornings and less in the afternoon . This is basically due to our position on the planet and the rotation of the earth . In any case , to take better advantage of the daylight available , we compensate by moving our clocks forward one hour .
column5: I see . That ' s convenient ! I never understood things like this , such as GMT . I never know what time zone we are in or when to change my clock !
column6: That just stands for Greenwich Mean Time . Here in California , we are in Pacific Standard Time , that is eight time zones west of Greenwich . Remember when we were in Beijing ? Well , then we were in China Standard Time , and that ' s eight time zones east of Greenwich !
column7: That ' s why it was so weird traveling from Beijing to LA ! Because of the huge time difference , even though we left Beijing at noon and flew for more than eight hours , we still arrived in LA the same day at noon ! It ' s like we went back in time !

column2: I ' Ve had it ! I ' m done working for a company that is taking me nowhere !
column3: So what are you gonna do ? Just quit ?
column4: That ' s exactly what I am going to do ! I ' Ve decided to create my own company ! I ' m going to write up a business plan , get some investors and start working for myself !
column5: Have you ever written up a business plan before ?
column6: Well , no , it can ' t be that hard ! I mean , all you have to do is explain your business , how you are going to do things and that ' s it , right ?
column7: You couldn ' t be more wrong ! A well written business plan will include an executive summary which highlights the idea of the business in two pages or less . Then you need to describe your company with information such as what type of legal structure it has , history , etc .
column8: Well , that seems easy enough .
column9: Wait , there ' s more ! Then you need to introduce and describe your goods or services . What they are and how they are different from competitors ' ? Then comes the hard part , a market analysis . You need to investigate and analyze hundreds of variables ! You need to take into consideration socioeconomic factors from GDP per capita to how many children on average the population has ! All this information is useful so that you can move on to your strategy and implementation stage , where you will describe in detail how you will actually execute your idea .
column10: Geez . Is that all ?
column11: Almost , the most important piece of information for your investors will be the financial analysis . Here you will calculate and estimate sales , cash flow and profits . After all , people will want to know when they will begin to see a return on their investment !
column12: Umm . I think I ' ll just stick to my old job and save myself all the hassle of trying to start up a business !

column2: It's hard to be optimistic about things with the way the economy's headed ... The trade deficit is getting larger , consumption's down , I really think we're headed for a recession .
column3: The economy has been stagnant for a while now . We've been in a recessive state for several months already . What worries me the most is the trade deficit . I think the government should do more to encourage exports .
column4: Increasing exports would weaken the currency . I think the main point is economic growth . We need more jobs . Factories have outsourced and moved many jobs to foreign countries . The result is an increase in unemployment in our own country , lower consumption , lower production , and an overall feeble economy . If more people are working , it will give the economy a boost .
column5: It's true that we should do something about unemployment , but what about inflation ? If unemployment falls , there's pressure to increase pay . That would result in inflation , which would result in a much less dynamic economy .

column2: Even if our company didn't have a dress code , I still think people would wear formal clothing to work .

column4: Maybe that's true for some positions , but I think the marketing and sales staff would definitely not agree . They dress for success ! You can't go out on a sales call if you are dressed in jeans . It's just not respectful to you client .
column5: I think what you wear is so overrated . I would rather have a down-to-earth , honest and solid sales person than a painted , patent leather , designer suite salesman .
column6: It's not as simple as that . People judge you by your appearance , whether you like it or not . So dressing professional is being professional . The image that you portray to others is so important in business . It's your image and how others perceive you that makes the difference between landing or losing a sale .
column7: Maybe you're right , but I'll take my sneakers and jeans any day !

column2: Isn't it wonderful walking here ?

column7: You're right , but when it was built in 1930 it was a marvel of technology and engineering .
column8: What other important buildings are we going to see on Fifth Avenue ?
column9: Quite a number . Actually every skyscraper has a history . A few blocks ahead we'll see St . Patrick ' s Cathedral and just across the street will be the world-renowed Rockefeller Center . It's a landmark in the history of architecture .
column10: What's there after that ?

column12: What are they all for ?
column13: Most of them are office buildings , huge department stores , and hotels but some are just private homes . New York is one of the financial centers of the world . And there are lots of very expensive places .

column2: Hey Kevin , what are you doing here ? Don't you usually spend Tuesday nights at home studying ?

column5: Nothing that serious . She finally told them that she moved out of the dormitory a few months ago and has been living with her boyfriend .

column10: How long has your sister been with her boyfriend ?
column11: Three years . They've been dating since freshman year . They're even talking about marriage .

column2: I am sorry to trouble you again , Mr . Stone .
column3: It's ok . What do you want to ask ?
column4: Where should I go after I arrived at the university ?
column5: The first place you should go is the International Center .
column6: Why ?
column7: You can get help there in dealing with the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service ; you can find Foreign Student Advisers .
column8: What kind of role do foreign student advisers play ?
column9: They'll discuss personal concerns , housing , adjustment , finances and other matters with you .
column10: Can we get any more help at the International Center ?
column11: Yes , a lot more . If you go there just before the beginning of the fall's semester , you can get your student ID and social security number there . They will keep your documents up-to-date . They will offer an orientation program for new comers . They will also help you contact your department and registration office .
column12: I see . It must be worth going to .
column13: Besides these , the center staff also works with community organizations which provide tours , home hospitality , speaking engagements and assistance for wives of foreign students . In cooperation with nationality clubs , student associations and other organizations , the International Center provides a varied program of cultural and social events throughout the year .
column14: Wonderful . It is a home for foreign students .
column15: It sure is . They also serve tea , coffee and refreshments . The Center staff members are also friendly and helpful . Everyone loves them .
